channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lamp-post 14 flickering constantly, 7th January
item.description:
Lamp-post 14 on Oakleigh Road N (nearby St Andrews Medical Practice) flickering constantly. Please replace
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Oakleigh Road North, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burst water pipe discharging on road, 7th January
item.description:
An underground water main appears to have burst and is discharging a large and constant volume of water onto the road surface. In the current weather this could become very dangerous if any of it freezes. The constant flow of water is opening the joints of a tarmac patch repair suggesting the mains pipe may have recently been worked on. Located behind Bickley Manor Hotel and rear exit for Bromley High girls school

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackbrook Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Parked Illegally, 7th January
item.description:
This time three cars parked illegally and causing a blockage which is making it difficult for larger vehicles to get past and actual residents to park and/or leave their driveways safely. Constant problem hear, which has been reported to the council on several occasions, but as usual, nothing is done.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Commonwealth Way, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety: Water Mains Ruptured, 7th January
item.description:
The Water-Main appears to have ruptured under the road surface The escaping water is freezing over causing a safety hazard to pedestrians and other road users.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Randall Place, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Soiled bedsheets middle of road between 16 and 18 Elmcroft road,, 7th January
item.description:
Heavily soiled with faeces bedsheets left in middle of road slightly to left side of road between 16 and 18 Elmcroft road, reported yesterday, received reply today saying not there, sheets are still in road, as described in position, are now flattened with traffic driving over sheets, driver needs to find the house on right of road with boarded windows the sheets flattened now in the road are just before that house, they need to be removed, using ppe and area needs to be sanitised, sheets are still in the road need to drive slowly find Correct house and remove sheets
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmcroft Road, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A very heavy branch fell onto the footpath., 7th January
item.description:
The branch could have killed a pedestrian. The tree is in need of pruning before somebody gets hurt. The offending tree is on PineWalk Allotment but is the responsibility of The Council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 7th January
item.description:
This vehicle, which has a flat tyre on the passenger side, has not moved in over a month. I reported it to the Met Police (CAD 4780) on 7th January. They informed me that the car is not registered at Delafield Road but it is from a neighbouring road. It is taxed and MOT’d but it has the look of an abandoned car.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Delafield Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycle wheelie bin not collected, 7th January
item.description:
My bins were put out on Sunday evening but nothing was taken from our bin. This is anrecurring issue for us, our black bin has very little in it because we are good recyclers, however, this is punished by collections when they take out a single bag and don't empty the bin properly, resulting in the bagged fox and cat feces being left at the bottom of what is already a fortnightly collection, so we're left with feces in our bins for months on end. Please could you train your staff to just load the bins onto the truck to empty fully instead of reaching into our bins and pulling a few items from the top

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadfield Road, Catford South, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting litter, 7th January
item.description:
I've reported litter in this location before. It hasn't been cleaned for 6 months. A dumped bed I reported months ago is still there. Should be checked for litter daily. There's bottles and beer cans in bushes and under them, remains of fireworks etc. Please clear!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tewson Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Tree root is pulling up public pathway slab, 7th January
item.description:
This is the second time one of the tree roots has pulled up the public slab - it was repaired in 2023. I believe that it is also travelling up my pathway and pulling up the crazy paving. This can be seen in the photos. I have been in contact with Bromley previously for this and, eventually, was told that it would be reviewed after 2 years, which it has been

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynsted Close, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
